parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Troas, a harbor city of Mysia. From Tros; the Troad, i.e. Troas, a place in Asia Minor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To run a straight course. From euthus and dromos; to lay a straight course, i.e. Sail direct.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Samothrace, an island south of the province of Thrace. From Samos and Thraike; Samo-thrace, an island in the Mediterranean.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: The next day. Feminine singular participle of a comparative of epi and heimi; supervening, i.e. the ensuing day or night.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
